questions.text: Tell me about yourself and your background
questions.answer: Iam Vignesh pursuing my B.tech in SECE in AI

questions.text: What interests you about this role?
Describe a challenging project you worked on
How do you handle tight deadlines?
Explain a complex technical problem you solved
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What is the difference between `git pull` and `git fetch`?
questions.answer: Git pull pulls the recent changes in repo

questions.text: What is the purpose of Docker, and how does it simplify deployment?
Explain your experience with RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation). How did you implement it in one of your projects, and what challenges did you face?
questions.answer: RAg is a technique  of making AI use the doc as knowledge base and answer the questions from user using that particular knowledge alone. Use in websites for org data

questions.text: Describe the architecture of VizCodeAssist, focusing on how the different components (React, FastAPI, Node.js, LLM, etc.) interact to provide codebase analysis and developer support.
questions.answer: VizCoAssist is used to auto generate high level and low level architectures  in easier way using AI where it also has an AI call agent to guide them which uses WebRTC and twilio to communicate with Ai for user queries in live

questions.text: You've used PEFT (Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning) and fine-tuned LLMs. Discuss the trade-offs between different PEFT techniques (e.g., LoRA, prefix tuning) and when you might choose one over another.  Include specific examples from your Plotch.ai internship.
questions.answer: PEFT is a parameter efficient fine tuning. Basically fine tuning is used to train an existing model ousing a new data to make it aligh with it and knowledge about it where PEFT is used to refuce the size of the model and use it anywhere or in machines with low memory ar computing resouce. it is widely used to tune a pre trained model for a specific use case to make it more accurate and efficient

questions.text: Imagine you are tasked with optimizing the performance of the AI Call Agent project, specifically addressing latency issues when handling a high volume of concurrent user requests.  Describe the specific steps you would take to identify bottlenecks, implement solutions (considering the existing tech stack: LLM, OpenAI, LangChain, Prompt Engineering, Twilio, WebSocket, ASR, TTS), and ensure scalability under heavy load. Be specific with technologies that you would consider adding or changing and reasoning behind those.
questions.answer: Twilio by default handles multi callers at a time which is multi tenant and highly scalable with paid version and plivo is also an alternative of Twolio. We can use Deepgram for ASR and TTS use cases for both dev and production because they provide large amount of free credits with high accuracy and efficiency. Prompt engineering is primarily used to make AI understand and nstruct what is user query and how to handle and answer it
questions.feedback: The answer focuses too much on replacing existing technologies without proper justification or a structured approach to identifying the bottlenecks. It mentions technologies like Twilio, Deepgram, and Prompt Engineering, but fails to articulate a clear plan for diagnosing latency issues and ensuring scalability. It lacks specifics on monitoring, profiling, and optimization techniques relevant to the given tech stack.
